channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Racist pro-Trump vandalism at college was carried out by fraudster
item.description: A racist pro-Trump message found at a Tennessee college is the latest example of a fraudster seeking to stoke fear by perpetrating a fake hate crime.

item.title: Speaker Johnson tees up next plan to avert shutdown
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson told reporters on Friday that he had another plan to avert a partial government shutdown after his previous two went up in ...

item.title: Watchdog seeks to halt 11th-hour Biden DOJ effort to ‘handcuff’ Kentucky police over Breonna Taylor incident
item.description: The Oversight Project is filing an amicus brief with a western Kentucky federal court seeking to warn against the approval of a consent decree it says...

item.title: The Fiscal Hawks Never Win
item.description: All the latest drama on Capitol Hill is unlikely to fundamentally alter our dreadful fiscal trajectory.

item.title: Online Dating’s Latest Innovation
item.description: Noninteraction.

item.title: DEI Is a Waste and Distraction at the University of Michigan
item.description: As the university begins to question the utility of DEI, some on campus may cling to it. They should be ignored.

item.title: Biden heading to Vatican City next month to meet with Pope Francis, Meloni in final overseas trip

item.title: House Republicans reach new plan to avoid government shutdown after back-to-back defeats
item.description: House Republicans have tentatively reached another deal to avert a partial government shutdown, as the clock ticks closer to midnight.

item.title: Court Records Blow Holes In The New York Times’ Latest Anti-Hegseth Smear
item.description: Court records and documents obtained by The Federalist show there's far more to the story than the Times lets on.

item.title: Donald Trump shifts shutdown blame: 'This is a Biden problem to solve'

item.title: How Trump Can Make The Auto Industry Great Again
item.description: Some of the world’s largest automakers may not survive our government-created debacle, but collapse of the industry can still be stopped.

item.title: Fed workers secretly cheering for shutdown; hoping for extra vacation
item.description: Some federal workers are "secretly hoping" for a government shutdown in the coming weeks, figuring it will earn them extra time off.

item.title: Top Senate Dems pour cold water on latest GOP spending bill plans: 'Ready to stay' through Christmas
item.description: Top Democrats urged Republicans to return to the original stopgap spending bill in order to avoid a partial government shutdown at midnight.

item.title: Joe Biden Met With Hunter’s Business Associates More Times Than With His Cabinet
item.description: The WSJ reports Biden met infrequently with his cabinet, while emails show he interacted 'countless' times with his degenerate son's clients.

item.title: China Unsheathes Its Doomsday Artillery
item.description: Just how did China gain such dominance across the board in critical materials?

item.title: Millions Of Americans Will Do Anything For Their Kids’ Sports, Including Cutting Church
item.description: Travel sports has grown into a $39 billion dollar industry while churches are seeing a decrease in members and Sunday worshippers.

item.title: Godard for Christmas
item.description: The controversial Hail Mary is more devout than controversial.
